description.narrative: Support systems in health and education settings are strengthened and harmonized to provide adolescent friendly services responding to the specific needs of adolescent girls and boys, especially the most marginalized, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Adolescent Health And Nutrition (Covid), Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Adolescents, including the most marginalized , are recognized as equal members of society and empowered to participate meaningfully in all aspects of life

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF EDUCATION AND SCIENCE REPUBLIC OF TAJIKISTAN

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Parent/caregiver education and programmes on violence, exploitation and abuse - across the life cycle
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework

UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners

UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Support systems in health and education settings are strengthened and harmonized to provide adolescent friendly services responding to the specific needs of adolescent girls and boys, especially the most marginalized

description.narrative: Adolescent mental health service provision, as part of Youth-friendly health services (YFHS), started in schools with a referral system and peer-to-peer support. 14,000 adolescents (16% of total in targeted schools) received mental health services. Re-activated HIV prevention work improved knowledge of 3,600 adolescents on HIV prevention through a peer-to-peer methodology. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2019

title.narrative: # of school and health professionals in targeted district areas with adequate capacity to provide appropriate support, including psychological support, to address the specific needs of adolescents, especially vulnerable groups
Number of children, parents and primary caregivers provided with community based mental health and psychosocial support and messaging [COVIDSitRep]
AFHS are integrated into PHC level and scaled-up

actual.value: 2019:The process is ongoing with the support that UNICEF is providing for conducting national adolescent check-up and assessment on efficiency of financing adolescent health services at PHC level. This are two milestones that have been on track to achieve this result in 2019.
